AboutPage.metaDescription: Learn about OSM for Cities - Daily updated datasets from OpenStreetMap
AboutPage.title: About
AboutPage.description1: OSM for Cities is an experimental platform to help people explore and follow updates from OpenStreetMap ‚Äî a free, open map of the world built by volunteers. Every day, people add and improve data about streets, buildings, schools, parks, transport, and more. This project gives you a way to track those changes in places you care about.
AboutPage.description2: You might want to keep an eye on edits to schools in your region, or monitor how crosswalks, bus stops, or bike racks are being added to your city. Maybe you're just curious about how your neighborhood park is evolving. Whether it's a critical dataset for urban planning or something more personal and informal, the platform lets you create and follow it.
AboutPage.feature1: Create custom datasets by selecting a place and a topic
AboutPage.feature2: Follow datasets and receive daily or weekly update summaries
AboutPage.feature3: See contributor activity and edit frequency for each dataset
AboutPage.feature4: Reuse or remix templates shared by other users
AboutPage.experiment1: OSM for Cities is a proof of concept created by <vitorLink>Vitor George</vitorLink> and developed as a Labs project by <devSeedLink>Development Seed</devSeedLink>. It's a space to test ideas around surfacing OSM data in useful, accessible ways.
AboutPage.experiment2: Whether it evolves into a broader tool will depend on how the community engages with it. The source code is open and available on <githubLink>GitHub</githubLink>.
AboutPage.getInvolvedDescription: Your feedback helps shape this experiment. Whether you have ideas for new features, found something that doesn't work quite right, or just want to share how you're using the platform ‚Äî we'd love to hear from you.

AreaSelector.searchPlaceholder: Please enter at least 3 characters to search
AreaSelector.searchDescription: Only administrative areas (cities, towns, neighborhoods) will be shown in results
AreaSelector.noAreasFound: No areas found. Try a different search term.

CreateDatasetWizard.selectAreaDescription: Type an area name and select from the suggestions. This can be a city, town, neighborhood, or any administrative area in OpenStreetMap.
CreateDatasetWizard.selectTemplateDescription: Choose a data template that defines what OpenStreetMap features to dataset.
CreateDatasetWizard.testQueryDescription: Test the selected template query against your chosen area to see what data will be monitored.
CreateDatasetWizard.confirmDescription: Review your selections and create your dataset.

CreateDatasetPage.createDescription: Follow the steps below to create a new dataset for tracking OpenStreetMap data.

QueryTester.selectAreaTemplateFirst: Please select an area and template first.
QueryTester.noResultsDescription: The query returned no results. This could mean:
QueryTester.noFeaturesMatch: No features match the criteria in this area
QueryTester.areaNoAmenities: The area might not have the specified amenities

PreferencesPage.reportsDescription: Get a summary of your monitors and their activity.
PreferencesPage.magicLinksDescription: Magic links for signing in are always enabled and cannot be disabled.

DatasetMap.noDataAvailable: No data available. Data will be automatically refreshed when you visit this page.
DatasetMap.noGeographicData: No geographic data found in the dataset results.
